title: Haverigg Walks

images.title: Haverigg Pool, Haverigg by Les Hull, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Haverigg Pool, Haverigg. This small river, flows through the village and joins the estuary of the River Duddon here.

images.title: Beach access at Haverigg by Andy Deacon, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: Haverigg inshore rescue team by Andy Deacon, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Haverigg inshore rescue team. An independent lifeboat station, Haverigg Inshore Rescue Team, has been based in the village since 1973 assisting those in difficulty around the Duddon coastline.

images.caption: View of Hodbarrow Lagoon

images.title: Steve Fareham / Haverigg beach begins to become salt marsh
images.caption: The beach at Haverigg Point, the southernmost point of Cumberland, begins to become salt marsh

images.title: Sand dunes on the Cumbria coastal path by Perry Dark, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Sand dunes on the Cumbria coastal path

description: This Cumbrian village lies in a scenic spot at the mouth of the Duddon Estuary. It's a fine place for a walk with the long distance Cumbria Coastal Way, the wildlife rich Hodbarrow Lakes Nature Reserve and the neighbouring town of Millom to explore. This figure of eight loop walk first circles the Hodbarrow Lakes before heading along the coast path towards the sand dunes of Haverigg Bank. The route then heads inland to visit Kirkstanton before follow country lanes back to Haverigg. On the way there's scenic beaches and fine views towards the nearby mountains of the Lake District.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Harbour Hotel is in a nice spot overlooking the river. There's two distinct comfortably furnished rooms and a large garden for warmer days. The inn is located on the Main Street at postcode LA18 4EX. There's also the Rising Sun, a dog friendly inn with a good selection of ales.

display_address: Steel Green, Haverigg, Millom, Cumberland, England, LA18 4HT, United Kingdom
